name: From Aberration to Zonation Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.text: Begins with A and ends with -ation. What word can be applied to a peculiarity or mutation?
questions.explanation:
aberration.

	Synonyms for aberration include oddity, peculiarity, and quirk. Aberrant can mean atypical, abnormal, deviant, eccentric, or anomalous.

questions.text: Begins with B and ends with -ation. What word describes the division of something into two parts?
questions.explanation:
bifurcation.

	For instance, the United States legislature underwent bifurcation into the Senate and the House of Representatives. Synonyms for bifurcation include division, separation, and divergence.

questions.text: Begins with C and ends with -ation. What word means "a light meal or spread of food"?
questions.explanation:
collation.

	Other C words ending in -ation include creation and continuation. Synonyms for this type of collation include buffet, banquet, and spread. Another meaning for collation is "data management". For example, in the textbook industry we sometimes have to collate particular learning standards to the exact places where they are taught in a textbook.

questions.text: Begins with D and ends with -ation. What word refers to the process of drying out?
questions.explanation:
dehydration & desiccation.

	Other d_____ation words include differentiation and defenestration. Semi-synonyms for dehydration include dryness, drought, and evaporation.

questions.text: Begins with E and ends with -ation. What word means "clarification or illumination"?
questions.explanation:
explanation & elaboration & elucidation & edification.

	Other e_____ation words include explication and expiation. Other synonyms for explanation include account, breakdown, and exposition.

questions.text: Begins with F and ends with -ation. What word means "aggravation or annoyance"?
questions.explanation:
frustration.

	Other f_____ation words include Frenchification, a made-up word. Other synonyms for frustration include vexation, obstruction, and disgruntlement.

questions.text: Begins with G and ends with -ation. What word is a synonym for "pregnancy"?
questions.explanation:
gestation.

	Other g_____ation words include gentrification. Other synonyms for gestation include gravidity, ripening, and maturation.

questions.text: Begins with H and ends with -ation. What word refers to the process of getting used to something?
questions.explanation:
habituation.

	Other h_____ation words include hydration and hallucination. Synonyms for habituation include adapting, accustomizing, and acclimatization.

questions.text: Begins with I and ends with -ation. What word refers to something that is newly created?
questions.explanation:
innovation.

	Other i_____ation words include imagination and immigration. Synonyms for innovation include modernization. An innovation is supposed to be an invention that is "on the cutting edge."

questions.text: Begins with J and ends with -ation. What word means "excuse or rationalization"?
questions.explanation:
justification.

	Other synonyms for justification include defense, exculpation, and reason. Antonyms include charge, indictment, and opposition. Words in the same family include just (meaning "fair"), justice, and justify.

questions.text: Begins with K and ends with -ation. What word (more commonly spelled with a C at the start) names a positively charged ion that is attracted to the cathode in electrolysis?
questions.explanation:
kation.

	Please send me more k_____ation words. Kation can also be spelled cation. Its adjective form is cationic.

questions.text: Begins with L and ends with -ation. What word is a synonym for "freedom" or "the act of setting free"?
questions.explanation:
liberation.

	Other l_____ation words include libation, lactation, and location. Other synonyms for liberation include deliverance, emancipation, and unshackling.

questions.text: Begins with M and ends with -ation. What word is a synonym for "menses"?
questions.explanation:
menstruation.

	Other m_____ation words include ministration and migration. Other synonyms for menstruation include monthlies, "the curse," and having one's period.

questions.text: Begins with N and ends with -ation. What word means "repudiation or nullification"?
questions.explanation:
negation.

	Other n_____ation words include nation and notation. Other synonyms for negation include antithesis and renunciation.

questions.text: Begins with O and ends with -ation. What word means "deception or prevarication"?
questions.explanation:
obfuscation.

	Other o_____ation include ovation and orientation. Synonyms for the verb to obfuscate include baffle, becloud, and befuddle. Antonyms include clarify, explain, and illuminate.

questions.text: Begins with P and ends with -ation. What word refers to a period during which a new employee is still under scrutiny before he or she becomes a permanent employee?
questions.explanation:
probation.

	Other p_____ation words include prevarication and protestation. Synonyms for probation include trial, apprenticeship, and noviciate.

questions.text: Begins with R and ends with -ation. What word refers to the process of bringing something back to its original pristine state?
questions.explanation:
restoration & reclamation.

	Other r_____ation words include ration and reforestation. Synonyms for restoration or reclamation include rejuvenation and renewal. Antonyms include destruction, deforestation, pollution, and neglect.

questions.text: Begins with S and ends with -ation. What word means "feeling" or "a smashing success"?
questions.explanation:
sensation.

	Other s_____ation words include station and speculation. Synonyms for sensation (meaning "a feeling") include vibes, sensibility, and awareness. Synonyms for the adjective sensational (meaning "wonderful") include thrilling, amazing, and astounding.

questions.text: Begins with T and ends with -ation. What word is a synonym for "fear"?
questions.explanation:
trepidation.

	Other t_____ation words include transubstantiation. Synonyms for trepidation include apprehension, uneasiness, and worriment. Antonyms include collectedness, composure, and ease.

questions.text: Begins with U and ends with -ation. What word refers to a takeover or the process of commandeering a position?
questions.explanation:
usurpation.

	Other u_____ation words include unification. Synonyms for usurpation include annexation, confiscation, and appropriation. Antonyms include release and letting go.

questions.text: Begins with V and ends with -ation. What word refers to humming, jiggling, trembling, or thrumming?
questions.explanation:
vibration.

	Other v_____ation words include variation, verification, and vacation. Synonyms for vibration include reverberation, quaking, and pulsation. Antonyms include stillness.

questions.text: I'm skipping W, X, and Y. Begins with Z and ends with -ation. What word means "the process of dividing something into zones"?
questions.explanation:
zonation.

	Please send in more z_____ation words. Synonyms for zonation include zoning and division. Antonyms include unification.

questions.text: Back to A. Begins with A and ends with -ation. What word could you use to fill in the blank to make a meaningful phrase with any one of the starting words? Clinton/Bush/Obama/Trump ________.
questions.explanation:
administration.

	Other a_____ation words include aberration and amplification. Synonyms for administration include authority, jurisdiction, and government. In the case of Donald Trump's administration, synonyms include rule, reign, and dictatorship.

questions.text: Back to D. Begins with D and ends with -ation. What word refers to the process of jumping (or being pushed) out of a window?
questions.explanation:
defenestration.

	As you know, other d_____ation words include dehydration, differentiation, and dispensation. Semi-synonyms for defenestration include expulsion, ejection, and riddance.

questions.text: Back to I. Begins with I and ends with -ation. What word is a synonym for "creativity"?
questions.explanation:
imagination & inspiration.

	Other i_____ation words include infestation and illumination. Synonyms for imagination include creativity, artistry, fancy, and ingenuity. Antonyms include reality and stolidness.
